title: Basic Use
text: designed fit piped/Tidyverse workflow. Thus, first parameter data.frame (tibble) second parameter unquoted variable specified data.frame

title: Basic Use
text: Results need printed. Results, instead, can assigned variable. results data.fram class “simplefreqs_freq” “data.frame”. object continue print simplefreqs_freqs object. needed, can remove “simplefreqs_freq” class object print regular data.frame.

title: Basic Use
text: default, simple bar chart produced alongside frequency table working interactively. can control plots parameter.  Plots can supressed.

title: Basic Use
text: default, results sorted descending order frequency. Alternatively, sorting can supressed. case, results sorted variables labels. character variables, alphabetic, factors order levels.
code: freq(mtcars, cyl, sort = TRUE) freq(mtcars, cyl, sort = FALSE)

title: Basic Use
text: NAs , default, included treated level variable. Alternatively, NAs can removed. case, NAs included frequency table, two relevent attribute set results. “na” include number NAs removed na_removed set TRUE.
code: df <- storms |>     freq(category, na.rm = FALSE) df df <- storms |>     freq(category, na.rm = TRUE) df attr(df, "na", exact = TRUE) [1] 14382 attr(df, "na_removed", exact = TRUE) [1] TRUE

title: Basic Use
text: printed results highly customizable, console output HTML output (PDF Word output less customizable). many available options control tables print. can set options per session (using options(simplefreqs.OPTION = VALUE)) adding similar lines project global .RProfile file. exposed customization options :

title: Basic Use
text: simplefreqs.big_mark (controls 1000’s seperator mark, defaults “,”) OutDec (base option controling decimal mark, defaults “.”) simplefreqs.decimal_digits (controls number decimal digits printed, defaults 1) simplefreqs.print_table_metadata (controls whether metadata printed, defaults FALSE) simplefreqs.print_table_total_row (controls whether total row printed, defaults TRUE) simplefreqs.print_header_divider (controls whether divider border printed, defaults TRUE) simplefreqs.print_table_symbol (controls whether table divider printed top bottom, default true)

title: Simple Frequency Tables
text: simplefreqs package contains single function, freq. basic, freq accepts data.frame variable inputs calculates resulting frequency table. can done stand-alone operation part pipeline. See basic usage vignette (vignette('basic-use', 'simplefreqs') details.
code: # Stand-alone freq(iris, Species)  # As part of pipeline iris |>   freq(Species)

title: Construct frequency table — freq
text: Prints frequency table specified variable.

title: Construct frequency table — freq
code: freq(   df,   var = NA,   plot = interactive(),   sort = TRUE,   markdown = !interactive(),   wt = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE )

title: Construct frequency table — freq
text: df data.frame (optionally, can pass variable first argument.) var variable associated data.frame plot TRUE prints bar chart results.  Default TRUE interactive(), otherwise FALSE sort TRUE (default), sort output descending order n. FALSE, sort output ascending order levels markdown false, formats table Rmarkdown/Quarto inclusion. wt variable representing weights na.rm FALSE (default) NAs included frequency list.  TRUE, NA removed (reported separately)

title: Construct frequency table — freq
text: data.frame containing frequencies.

title: Construct frequency table — freq
text: function constructs frequency table specified variable. expects data.frame first argument (unquoted) variable second argument. thus fit tidyverse pipeline.  Alternatively, convenience, vector can passed first argument var (second) argument left blank. console printed table highly customizable using session, project, global options.  following options currently implemented can set calling `options()` either interactively including .Rprofile. - simplefreqs.inner_table_padding - simplefreqs.table_symbol - simplefreqs.row_divider_symbol - simplefreqs.print_table_symbol - simplefreqs.print_table_total_row - simplefreqs.print_table_metadata - simplefreqs.print_header_divider - simplefreqs.big_mark - simplefreqs.decimal_digits
